channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dead fox on pavement, 24th February
item.description:
Dead fox on pavement
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 243-247A, Halfway Street, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Post office and electricity manhole cover is lose, 24th February
item.description:
So the roots of the unkept tree by the council is moving the pavement (potentially my house to warn you) and now the manhole cover doesn’t fit. When people walk on it not only does it make a loud noise 24x7 it also vibrates into my house… things on my mantelpiece shake as does the mirror on my wall. What are your plans to fix this?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kendall Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain cover loose and cars making it make a noise, 24th February
item.description:
The drain cover is moving as cars constantly drive over it therefore making a constant banging noise. Near bus stop K
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, North Cray Road, Bexley, Greater London

item.title: Severe damage to one of the speed bumps, 24th February
item.description:
There is severe damage to one of the speed bumps, looks like a large part has fallen away leaving a sharp exposed hole at the side of the speed bump which can easily cause damage to a wheel
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dollis Road, Church End, Greater London

item.title: Weekly/Daily litter across pavement., 24th February
item.description:
At least every week, if not most days for the past year there is a huge amount of household litter and waste covering the pavements & road on the walk down to the station. It seems residents may be using a public litter bin / pavements for household waste as there is no private bin to be seen.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ledrington Road, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lamp post out, 24th February
item.description:
The lamp post with the EV charging unit installed is out there is no power to the EV charger or the lamp post itself. It is in total darkness.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 96, Canterbury Avenue, Albany Park, Sidcup, Greater London

item.title: Buggy from neighbours upstairs, 24th February
item.description:
Please can you request the neighbours upstairs take their buggy up as it is blocking my access. It has been a number of months now and means I have to take my things out the front and around the entire building.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southend Close, Eltham

item.title: Second light in this road not working properly, 24th February
item.description:
This road is in a conservation area and both lamps are Victorian and neither are working, therefore whole road is in darkness. Lamp post one, at the far end of the road, was reported in 2023 and we are still waiting for action. Now lamp post two, in the middle of the road only has a very dim light. Both need repair urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Upper Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dirthy muddy path, 24th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leithcote Path, Streatham Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken manhole, 24th February
item.description:
Broken manhole cover located on the pavement in front of 86 Southborough Road, Bickley. I noticed this issue on today. The manhole cover appears to be significantly damaged, with parts of it broken, posing a serious hazard to pedestrians, cyclists, and vehicles. This could lead to accidents or injuries, and it disrupts the usual flow of traffic in the area. I kindly request that this issue be reviewed as soon as possible to prevent any potential accidents and to ensure the safety of the community.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southborough Road, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
